topic.title: Pop-up Form Control
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_popup built-in form control is used to offer a contextual menu that provides quick access to various actions. A pop-up form control can display single or multiple selections.

body.p:
The oxy_popup form control supports the following properties:
If the value of the rows property is not specified, the default value of 12 is used.
This property is used for rendering in the Author mode.
Example:link:before{ content: oxy_popup( edit, '@href', values, "Spring, Summer, Autumn, Winter", tooltips, "Iris${comma}Snowdrop, Gardenia${comma}Liliac, Chrysanthemum${comma}Salvia, Gerbera", selectionMode, single); }
The value of the resultSeparator property cannot exceed one character.
labels - Specifies the label associated with each entry used for presentation. If this property is not specified, the values property is used instead.
This property is used for the visual representation of the form control.
p:before { content: oxy_popup(hoverPseudoclassName, 'showBorder') } p:showBorder { border: 1px solid red; }

p.codeblock: popupWithMultipleSelection:before { content: " This editor edits an attribute value. The possible values are specified inside the CSS: " oxy_popup( edit, "@attribute", values, "value1, value2, value3, value4, value5", labels, "Value no1, Value no2, Value no3, Value no4, Value no5", resultSeparator, "|", columns, 10, selectionMode, "multiple", color, "blue", fontInherit, true); font-size:30px; }

body.note: To insert a sample of the oxy_popup form control in a CSS file (or LESS file), invoke the Content Completion Assistant by pressing and select the oxy_popup code template.
